messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] a request
messages.msgSnippet: Sue I ve forwarded your email to the HEQT list. It appears to be very relevant to a recent debate we were having. Single parents who are legally seperated
messages.messageBody:
Sue

I've forwarded your email to the HEQT list.
It appears to be very relevant to a recent debate we were having.

'Single parents who are legally seperated from their partners (or have no
partners) and who are responsible for the day-to-day upbringing of children
should have the same rights as both parents in making decisions over their
children's upbringing.'



Chris Swift

HEQT - Home Education Question Time
We debate the issues other groups don't even like mentioned.
To subscribe : HEQT-subscribe@...
Web Page: http://www.topica.com/lists/HEQT/



----- Original Message -----
From: "Pamela Sorooshian" <pamsoroosh@...>
To: <unschooling-discussion@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 29, 2003 4:26 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] a request


NHEN's New Homeschooler Encouragement Newsletter (N-H-E-N) is looking
for homeschoolers who are willing to share some advice on the recurring
question:

"What do you do when you have a relatives (or maybe even a spouse) who
aren't happy about the decision to homeschool?"

With each issue, N-H-E-N helps new homeschoolers connect with parents
from all over the country who have experienced some of the
same obstacles. This is an easy way to reach out and help someone who's
having a rough time. Simply send your responses to N-H-E-N@... as
soon as possible.

And, if you know of homeschool websites with articles that address this
issue, please send us that link too.

Thanks!
Sue Patterson
N-H-E-N Editor


~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*
National Home Education Network
www.NHEN.org

New Homeschooler Encouragement Newsletter
http://www.nhen.org/newhser/default.asp?id=418
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

messages.messageBody:
Hi all,
If you could, please remember to change the subject line for those of us who
want to stay informed, just not on everything. Too many great ideas and tooo
little time.....

Thanks!
Julie
